body:
Ah yeah, that's true. For zoho we definitely need the region. I'll push the fix to at least give the correct error. 

For fixing `rclone authorize` we could have `oauthutil.Config` output a serialized version of the config map which can then be passed to `rclone authorize`.

I've had a go at fixing this in the [fix-5178-authorize branch](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5178-authorize).

This seems to work in my tests.

Can you have a go with it @buengese ?

This encodes the configmap into a base64 encoded JSON blob and the same is returned from `rclone authorize`. This works with zoho other than the odditiy of having to answer the post config questions twice.

Do you think the base64 encoded blobs are OK? I decided to use those rather than plain JSON as JSON is rather difficult to escape on the command line - those `""` are difficult to escape on Windows.

That's excellent and definitely works for me to. 
> This works with zoho other than the odditiy of having to answer the post config questions twice.

In theory, we could have `oauthutil.Config` communicate back that it ran in headless mode and skip the rest of the config function based on it.

>Do you think the base64 encoded blobs are OK?

Base64 encoded JSON is the obvious choice here and avoids all the unnecessary problems. There aren't many reasons why you'd want to read or modify it other than debugging maybe, and it's not like it takes more than a second or so to decode base64.

> That's excellent and definitely works for me to.
> 
> > This works with zoho other than the odditiy of having to answer the post config questions twice.
> 
> In theory, we could have `oauthutil.Config` communicate back that it ran in headless mode and skip the rest of the config function based on it.

I think we do that in the drive backend, let me check...

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/0caf417779c35457f923b6d84879318711f98db5/backend/drive/drive.go#L956-L959

Not entirely sure that is sensible but that is what it does to avoid the same thing on the drive backend.

> > Do you think the base64 encoded blobs are OK?
> 
> Base64 encoded JSON is the obvious choice here and avoids all the unnecessary problems. There aren't many reasons why you'd want to read or modify it other than debugging maybe, and it's not like it takes more than a second or so to decode base64.

Great!

Thanks for testing :-)

I've pushed this now. I saw your fix for the above :-)

Thanks for testing.

issue.title: Onedrive URL Token Request

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When using rclone with custom endpoints that is token and authorize url in headless machine the new urls are not sent which is causing issue in getting the token.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.54.1
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.8

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Windows 10 64 bit , Ubuntu 20 Server 64 Bit (Both latest and updated), Actually irrelevant for this problem.

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Onedrive ( But suspect problem in another remote as well in which custom endpoints are required for token refresh)

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone config -> token update

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

irrelevant.
